text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Syrian newspapers on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- President Hafez al-Assad receives message from Sultan Qaboos of Oman and reviews developments with Omani minister of culture.
- French Foreign Minister Herve de Charette says Syria key effective party in Middle East peace process.
- Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak stresses rejection to visiting Israel.
- Arab League chief urges effective Asian role in the Middle East peace process.
- Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu shruggs off criticism of U.S. President Bill Clinton and the world over Israeli settlement plan in Jerusalem.
- European countries suggest a decision to the Security Council to prevent Israeli plans for building Jewish housing in occupied Arab lands.
- Peoples Assembly (parliament) listens to the answers of the finance ministry over agricultural and electricity issues.
- Total cereals' movement in Syrian silos was 5.4 million tonnes in 1996.
- Syrian State Minister for Foreign Affairs Naser Qaddour meets visiting American military delegation.
- The south Lebanon ceasefire committee calls for self- restraint and the English newspaper The Guardian says Israel is trapped in south Lebanon.
- India renews support for Syrian stands in the peace process.
- Japanese envoy Hiroshi Hirabayashi arrived in Damascus carrying a letter from Japanese Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto to Assad.
- Algeria says no normalisation with Israel.
